page.title: 12FOREST OF DEAN ROAD WORKERS
page.content: THE ROADMEN BASED AT CANNOP ROAD MAINTENANCE DEPOT WORK FROM 7.45 A.M. TO 4.30 P.M. & QUITE OFTEN LONGER IN THE WINTER WHEN THEY SPREAD SALT & GRIT DURING THE EVENING, NIGHT AND EARLY MORNING, ON ICY ROADS. OTHER JOBS INCLUDE DIGGING ROADS, LAYING TARMAC, PAVING, LAYING KERBSTONES, ROAD SWEEPING, AND CLEANING VERGES AND DRAINS. FOR THIS THEY GET AN AVERAGE WEEKLY WAGE OF Â£80 TO Â£100 A WEEK WITHOUT BONUSES FOR OVERTIME. ALL MEN GO ON A SPECIAL COURSE. TO HELP THEM IN THEIR WORK THEY HAVE TRACTORS, LORRIES, MOWERS, ROLLERS, PAVING MACHINES, DRAIN CLEANERS AND DRILLS, WHICH ARE ALL RENTED FROM A CENTRAL DEPOT. IT COSTS Â£14 PER HOUR FOR A TEN TON LORRY.
